clean_content:
Definition / general

* A benign developmental odontogenic cyst, mostly unilocular, with a fibrous tissue wall lined predominantly or entirely by orthokeratinized stratified squamous epithelium

Essential features

* Cystic bone lesion in mandible or maxilla with compatible radiological features* Cyst has orthokeratinized stratified squamous epithelial lining* Cyst wall is fibrous and uninflamed

Terminology

* Previously called orthokeratinized variant of odontogenic keratocyst (OKC) (no longer recommended to use by WHO)

Epidemiology

* Comprised 10.5% of cases in series of odontogenic keratocysts ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))* Comprises probably 1% of all odontogenic cysts* Peak incidence during third and fourth decades* More common in males (3:1) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))

Sites

* Most commonly (90.16%) involves mandible (mandibular molar and ramus) ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))* Maxilla involvement in 9.84% of cases* Multiple and bilateral cases have been reported

Pathophysiology

* Thought to originate from dental lamina and its remnants; developmental in nature

Etiology

* Unknown

Clinical features

* Most present as painless asymptomatic swelling ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))* Others discovered incidentally in orthodontic radiographs

Diagnosis

* Requires correlation of orthopantomogram (OPG) findings with histological features

Radiology description

* Orthopantomogram
  + Well demarcated unilocular radiolucency (93%) with a corticated margin ([Dentomaxillofac Radiol 2010;39:455](21062939))+ Associated with unerupted tooth in 50 - 75% of cases ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617), [Dentomaxillofac Radiol 2010;39:455](21062939))

Radiology images

Contributed by Nasir Ud Din, M.B.B.S.  

[![OOC right mandible](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin01.jpg)
 
[![OOC right mandible](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin02.jpg)

Right mandible

Prognostic factors

* Overall prognosis is good* Recurrence seen in 2% ([Dentomaxillofac Radiol 2010;39:455](21062939), [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))

Case reports

* 18 year old woman with posterior mandible calcification ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2018;22:S20](29491599))* 20 and 23 year old men with multiple tumors of mandible and maxilla ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:381](31119532))* 41 year old man with tumor in maxilla ([Turk Patoloji Derg 2017;33:81](25110243))* 41 year old man with tumor of condylar head ([Rom J Morphol Embryol 2017;58:689](28730263))* 50 year old man with tumor of maxilla masquerading as dentigerous cyst ([Int J Appl Basic Med Res 2016;6:297](27857903))* 52 year old man with progression into squamous cell carcinoma of left mandible ([World J Clin Cases 2019;7:1686](31367628))

Treatment

* Enucleation

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizedsrmjrds01.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/srmj/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=srmj:2014:05040:00014&i=F1-14&year=2014&issue=05040&article=00014&type=Fulltext)

Extraoral swelling

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizedsrmjrds02.jpg)](https://journals.lww.com/srmj/_layouts/15/oaks.journals/ImageView.aspx?k=srmj:2014:05040:00014&i=F2-14&year=2014&issue=05040&article=00014&type=Fulltext)

Obliterated buccal sulcus

Gross description

* If an intact cyst is enucleated:
  + Keratinous material filled cystic lesion+ Usually unilocular but may be multilocular+ Fibrous cyst membrane may envelope crown of molar tooth ([Int J Appl Basic Med Res 2016;6:297](27857903))* In curated specimens:
    + Multiple flattened, irregular, soft to firm and pearl white to gray-white to tan-brown cystic tissue fragments

Gross images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizedpmc02.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5108112/figure/F2/)

Cyst lining envelops crown of tooth

Frozen section description

* Frozen section is seldom done for odontogenic cysts

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Noninflamed fibrous cyst wall lined by thin uniform stratified squamous epithelium* Prominent granular layer* Thick luminal lamellated keratin (onion skin-like)* Chevroning of lamellated keratin in some cases* Cuboidal to flat basal layer* No surface corrugation or basal palisading is seen* Focal parakeratinized epithelium in case of inflammation* Reference: [Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617)

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Kelly Magliocca, D.D.S., M.P.H. and Nasir Ud Din, M.B.B.S.  

[![Orthokeratinized odontogenic cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca27.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca27.jpg)

Orthokeratinized odontogenic cyst

[![Cyst wall fragments](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin03.jpg)
 
[![Cyst wall fragments](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin04.jpg)

Cyst wall fragments

[![Cyst wall lumen](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin05.jpg)

Cyst wall lumen

  

[![Cyst wall fragments](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin06.jpg)
 
[![Cyst wall fragments](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin07.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin07.jpg)

Cyst lining

[![Cyst wall fragments](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin08.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillaorthokeratinizeduddin08.jpg)

Cyst lining

Positive stains

* Immunohistochemical stains are not usually used for diagnostic purpose* Decreased [Ki67](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainski67.html) index and [p53](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsp53.html) staining when compared with odontogenic keratocyst ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2010;134:271](20121617))* Reduced expression of [BCL2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbcl2.html), **bax**, [p53](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsp53.html) and **TGFα** as compared with odontogenic keratocyst ([Oral Oncol 2009;45:e41](19362040), [Dent Res J (Isfahan) 2012;9:S39](23814560))* [Cytokeratin 10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck10.html) positivity with variable expression of [cytokeratin 13](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck1.html#cytokeratin13ck13271412) and [14](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck14.html) ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2002;94:732](12464899))* Expression of [cytokeratin 1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck1.html), [2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck1.html#ck2), [10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck10.html) and **loricrin**
          + This profile suggests differentiation toward normal epidermis ([Hum Pathol 2010;41:1718](20801488))

Sample pathology report

* Right posterior mandible, enucleation:
  + Orthokeratinized odontogenic cyst (see comment)+ Comment: Histologic and radiologic features support the diagnosis.

Differential diagnosis

* [Odontogenic keratocyst (OKC)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillakeratocyst.html):
  + Peak incidence in second and third decades+ Mostly solitary, unilocular, well demarcated radiolucency+ Multiple cysts in 10% of cases+ Much more common+ Associated with nevoid basal cell carcinoma syndrome+ Associated with aggressive behavior (28 - 30% recurrence)+ Thin uniform lining of parakeratinized squamous epithelium+ Corrugated layer of parakeratin on its luminal surface+ Palisaded layer of columnar basal cells (reverse polarity)+ No keratohyalin granules+ Lumen may contain keratinaceous debris+ Frequent separation of the epithelial lining from underlying connective tissue+ Dental lamina rests and microcysts occasionally present in capsule wall* [Dentigerous cyst (DC)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxilladentigerous.html):
    + Radiologically similar as both are associated with unerupted molar tooth of mandible+ Much more common+ Peak incidence in second to fourth decades of life+ Noninflamed lining is thin; 2 - 3 layers of regular nonkeratinizing stratified squamous epithelium+ Inflamed lining is hyperplastic with elongated rete ridges+ Mucus metaplasia and cilia are also seen

Additional references

* [Diagn Pathol 2019;14:28](30947718),
  [Histopathology 1998;32:242](9568510),
  [Case Rep Dent 2013;2013:672383](24191203)
